transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. transcripts.original_text: State of New York Montgomery Margaret Timmerman being duly sworn deposth and saith that she is aged sixty seven years that she was acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was present at the wedding and that she was also married at the same time at my fathers house in >>> in said county ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife lives together for some time in the same town where she this deponent did in said town of >>> further south >>> Sworn and >>> before me this 4th day of September 1838 John Haven, Justice of the Peace Margaret Timmerman X her mark I John Haven a Justice of the Peace of the town of >>> in the county of Montgomery before whom the >>> of >>> was taken to hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Timmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did mark her mark all before me September 4th, 1838. John Hawn, Justice State of New York Montgomery County Clerks Office I certify that John W. Hawn esq. whole name is subscribed to the Justice of the forgoing affidavit and proceedings was on the day of the date >>> a Justice of the Peace >>> and for the County of Montgomery duly elected and >>> and that the signature to the same is his genuine signature.
transcripts.extracted_text: Montgomery State of New York 		}	S. of Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn deposith & saith that she is aged sixty years, that she was acquainted with Henry Hoove and Nancy Hoove at the time they were married; that she saw Present at the  Wedding and that she was also married about the same time at my fathers House in Ulunlin in said County  and that Lemmon Beak performed the Marriage  ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that  she knows that the said Henry Hoove and Nancy his  wife lived together for some time in the same Town  where the first deponent did in said Town of Ulunlin in said same State. Swarn and subscribed before me this 4 day of September 1883 her Margaret X Zimmermann mark John W. Keavo Justice of the Peace 		} I John W. Keavo a Justice of the Peace of the Town of Ulunlin in the County of Ulunlin do hereby certify  that above affadavit was taken before me the subscribing well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity entitling her statement entitled  to credit and that she was not taught to write and   did make her mark in the before me Sep 4, 1883 John W. Keavo Justice  State of New York 		} John W. Keavo Esq , whose name Montgomery County  Clarks Office} is subscribed to the Jurat of her above affidavit & proceedings was on the day of the date thereof a Justice x of the Peace in and for the County of Montgomery, duly elected and qualified and that the signature to the same is red germine signature  In testimony whereof I have hereunto set  my hand and office the office of Sept Eleventh day of September in the year 1883           A. J. Lavinie, clerk

transcripts.extracted_text: State of New York Montgomery ss  Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn deposeth & saith that she is upwards of Eighty years that she was acquainted with Henry Houce and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was Present at the Wedding and that she was also Married at the same time by my Father House in Minden in said County and that Dominus Boath performed the Marriage Ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she believes that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife Lived together for some time in the same house where she this deponent did in said Town of Minden further saith not  Sworn & Subscribed before me                   Margaret X Zimmerman this 4th day of September 1838                                   mark John W Heacom Justice of the Peace  I John W Heacom a Justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom the above affidavit was taken do hereby Certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good Character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to Credit and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark before me Sept 4th 1838                                                    John. W. Heacom Justice  State of New York Montgomery County  Clerks Office ss I certify that John W Heacom Esqr whose name is subscribed to the proof & c of the foregoing appears of proceeding was on the day of its date therein a Justice of the Peace in & for the County of Montgomery duly elected and qualified and that the signature to the same is his Genuine signature                                                    J M Haswell Clk My hand and official seal at Fonda this Eleventh day of September, in the year 1838
